Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater; interior glazed streaky black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of part of satyr bending to right with tail raised, defecating while making love to possibly a maenad (only backside preserved, possibly with trace of added white on flesh), also bending over, to right; at far left, possibly part of another figure.
Curator's comments: Venit interprets the satyr's stool as an imitation inscription.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 282, no. B246)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0158) (Phase 1)
